document.heading: District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Conforming Amendments Amendment Temporary Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-67, the “District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Conforming Amendments Amendment Temporary Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-390, which was retained by Council. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 26, 1989, and October 10, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 27, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-102 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

AN ACT ~rolle4 Original Codification, District of Columbia Code (1990 Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA OCT 7 1989 To amend, on a temporary basis, the District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 to conform to the requirements of the Family Support Act of 1988. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Conforming Amendments Amendment Temporary Act of 1989 Sec. 2. Title V of the District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982, effective April 6, 1982 (D.C. Law 4-101; D.C. Code, sec. 3-205.1 et seq is amended as follows a) The second sentence of section 505(1 DoC. Code, sec. 3-205.5(1) is amended by inserting the word "not" between the words "shal I" and "include b) Section 511 (D.C. Code, sec 205.11) is amended as follows I) By amending subsection (a) as follows A) By amending paragraph (I) by striking the number 75" and inserting the number 90" in its place B) By amending paragraph (2) as follows i) By striking the phrase 160 per month per child" and inserting the phrase 175 per month per child for a child under 2 years of age" in its place; and (ii) By striking the phrase "a maximum of $120 if the individual has worked less than 120 hours in the month" and inserting the phrase "a maximum of $200 per month per child for a child under 2 years of age" in its place 2) By amending the Ist sentence of paragraph (5) by striking the phrase "not already disregarded" and inserting the following phrase in its place: Section 3-205.5 Section 3-205. ii Enrolle4 Original "The $30 plus one-third disregard for individuals found otherwise eligible will be applied before the disregards specified in paragraph (2) of this subsection and after the disregard specified in paragraph (1) of this subsection and (3) By adding a new paragraph (5A) to read as follows 5A) Disregard any Federal Earned Income Tax Credit received Sec. 3 a) This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code, sec. 1-233(c)(I and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations b) This act shall expire on the 225th day of its having taken effect C~o~c~nof the District of Columbia District of Columbia APPROVED: October 27, 1989 Item on Consent Calendar ACTION & DATE: VOICE VOTE: COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA Council Period Eight RECORD OF OFFICIAL COUNCIL VOTE DOCKET NO: Bill 8-390 Adopted First Reading, 9-26-89 Approved Recordedvoteonrequest Absent: all present [] ROLL CALL VOTE RESULT COUNCIL MEMBER AYE NAY NV.
